exercises.name: Hip Circles
exercises.description: Loosens hip joints and warms up the lower body
instructions: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart
Place hands on your hips
Shift your weight slightly to your left foot
Begin making circles with your hips
Move your hips forward, right, back, and left
Make the circles as large as comfortable
Do 10 circles in one direction
Then reverse for 10 circles the other way
Switch standing leg and repeat

modifications.easier: Smaller circles, hold onto something for balance

exercises.name: Shoulder Circles
exercises.description: Releases tension and improves shoulder mobility
instructions: Stand or sit tall with arms relaxed at your sides
Lift your shoulders up towards your ears
Roll them back, squeezing shoulder blades together
Drop them down away from your ears
Roll them forward to complete the circle
Move slowly and deliberately
Do 10 circles backwards (the priority direction)
Then 10 circles forwards

modifications.harder: Add light weights or resistance band

exercises.name: Ankle Circles
exercises.description: Improves ankle mobility and prepares feet for activity
instructions: Sit in a chair or stand holding onto something
Lift your right foot off the ground
Point your toes and make circles with your foot
Move from the ankle, not the whole leg
Do 10 circles clockwise
Then 10 circles anticlockwise
Switch to left foot and repeat
Try to make the circles as large as possible

modifications.harder: Write the alphabet with your toes

exercises.name: Neck Rolls
exercises.description: Releases neck tension — perfect for desk workers
instructions: Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed
Drop your chin to your chest
Slowly roll your head to the right
Bring your right ear towards right shoulder
Continue rolling head back (look up gently)
Roll to the left, ear towards left shoulder
Return chin to chest to complete the circle
Do 5 slow circles, then reverse direction
IMPORTANT: Move slowly and never force

modifications.easier: Half circles only (ear to ear, not going back)
modifications.harder: Add gentle hand pressure for deeper stretch

exercises.name: Thoracic Rotation
exercises.description: Improves mid-back mobility — essential for desk workers and athletes
instructions: Start on hands and knees in tabletop position
Place your right hand behind your head
Rotate your upper body to the right
Lead with your elbow, opening your chest to the ceiling
Look up towards your raised elbow
Return to start with control
Don't let your hips move — rotation is from mid-back
Do 8-10 reps, then switch sides

modifications.harder: Hold at end range for 2-3 breaths

exercises.name: World's Greatest Stretch
exercises.description: Full-body mobility drill that hits hips, thoracic spine, and hamstrings
instructions: Start in a push-up position
Step your right foot to the outside of your right hand
Keep your left leg straight, knee off the ground
Drop your right elbow towards the floor inside your right foot
Hold for 2-3 breaths
Place right hand on the floor
Rotate and reach your right arm to the ceiling
Look up at your raised hand
Hold for 2-3 breaths
Return to start and switch sides

modifications.easier: Skip the rotation, just do the lunge stretch
modifications.harder: Add a hamstring stretch by straightening front leg

exercises.name: 90/90 Hip Stretch
exercises.description: Deep hip opener that targets both internal and external rotation
instructions: Sit on the floor
Position your front leg at 90 degrees in front of you
Position your back leg at 90 degrees behind you
Both knees should be bent at 90-degree angles
Sit up tall — use your hands for support if needed
You should feel a stretch in your front hip (external rotation)
And your back hip (internal rotation)
Hold for 60-90 seconds, then switch sides

modifications.easier: Sit on a yoga block or pillow, lean back on hands
modifications.harder: Lean forward over front leg, or lift back knee

exercises.name: Wrist Circles
exercises.description: Essential for anyone who types, lifts weights, or does push-ups
instructions: Extend your arms in front of you
Make fists with both hands
Slowly rotate your wrists in circles
Make the circles as large as comfortable
Do 10 circles in each direction
Then open and close your fingers 10 times
Finally, shake out your hands loosely

modifications.easier: Smaller circles, support wrist with other hand
modifications.harder: Add wrist flexor and extensor stretches

exercises.name: Kneeling Hip Flexor Stretch
exercises.description: Opens the hip flexors that get tight from sitting
instructions: Kneel on your left knee with right foot forward
Place a cushion under your knee if needed
Keep your torso upright
Tuck your pelvis under (posterior pelvic tilt)
Shift your weight forward until you feel a stretch
The stretch should be in the front of your left hip
Keep your core engaged throughout
Hold for 30-60 seconds, then switch sides

modifications.harder: Reach arm overhead on stretching side, add side bend

exercises.name: Wall Calf Stretch
exercises.description: Stretches the calves and Achilles — important for runners and walkers
instructions: Stand facing a wall, arm's length away
Place both hands on the wall at shoulder height
Step your right foot back about 2-3 feet
Keep your right heel firmly on the ground
Keep your right leg straight
Bend your left knee and lean towards the wall
Feel the stretch in your right calf
Hold for 30 seconds, then switch legs

modifications.harder: Step further back, or bend back knee slightly for deeper Achilles stretch

exercises.name: Thread the Needle
exercises.description: Thoracic rotation stretch that opens the upper back and shoulders
instructions: Start on hands and knees in tabletop position
Lift your right arm out to the side
Thread your right arm under your body
Slide it along the floor to the left
Let your right shoulder and head rest on the floor
Your left arm can stay straight or bend for support
Feel the stretch in your right shoulder and upper back
Hold for 30 seconds, then switch sides

modifications.easier: Don't go as deep, use a pillow under head
modifications.harder: Reach top arm overhead for deeper stretch

exercises.name: Arm Circles
exercises.description: Dynamic warm-up that increases shoulder mobility and blood flow
instructions: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart
Extend your arms straight out to the sides
Make small circles with your arms
Gradually increase the size of the circles
Keep your core engaged and stand tall
Do 10-15 circles forward
Then 10-15 circles backward
Finish by shaking out your arms

modifications.harder: Hold light weights, increase circle size
